Text: Attention all #GA06 high school students! I am pleased to announce my 2022 Congressional Art Competition. My office will accept submissions for this exciting competition until April 22nd. For more information on how to submit your artwork, visit https://t.co/KQyWyGhKKp.

I know that this time has been filled with pain and heartbreak for Ahmaud's family‚Äîmy love and prayers are with them always.

I pray that one day, we can build a world where no parent ever has to experience that pain.

Two years ago, a young man was murdered for being black, and a bright future was stolen by men with hate in their hearts. 

Two years after Ahmaud Arbery was killed while jogging down the road, his murderers were convicted of federal hate crimes.

Starting soon: My Veterans Mental Health Webinar with representatives from the @DeptVetAffairs will begin this morning at 11:00 am. It's not too late to sign up and join us! Visit https://t.co/a3u8gO8zlV to RSVP. https://t.co/GXhvfw0VP4

Today is the late John Lewis's birthday.

He was an inspiration to many, myself included. I continue to remember him as a man who sought to end injustice, right what was wrong, and heal the pain in our world. May we always honor his legacy.
https://t.co/xvcLqd81Q9
Ana R. contacted our office to request assistance obtaining an important immigration document. https://t.co/ey7jt0YcOi
I hope you will join me in thanking the caregivers across our country today! I am thankful for their compassion, commitment, and sacrifice on #NationalCaregiversDay, and every day.

Tonight at 6:30pm, I'm hosting an Infrastructure Town Hall! We'll talk about the funding the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is sending to Georgia to improve our roads and bridges, deliver good-paying jobs, and help connect families.

Register & stream here: https://t.co/NQ2hOwokwI

I will convene technical experts from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services to discuss the Open Enrollment period. I hope you can join us. To RSVP and to submit your questions, please visit: https://t.co/mYds1B6noJ

January 1st to March 31st is the Medicare Advantage Open Enrollment Period. For any Medicare beneficiary who may have questions about the process of changing their current plan, I am convening a Medicare Advantage Open Enrollment Webinar on Thursday, February 24th at 11:00 am. https://t.co/oLz9hVOefp

27 years ago, I became "Jordan's Mom." It will forever be the most important title I'll ever hold.
 
On my son's birthday, I'm celebrating all the years we shared and the impact he had on all of our lives.
 
Happy birthday, Jordan. We love you and miss you deeply. https://t.co/R4MPHllvCx

Joining me will be experts from the @DeptVetAffairs to discuss a variety of topics, including resources and programs that promote good mental health and safety for veterans such as telehealth therapy and safe firearm storage. RSVP to submit your questions: https://t.co/a3u8gO8zlV

I want our retired military service members who may be struggling to know you can reach out to my office for help. If you are a veteran or family member of a veteran, I invite you to join me at 11:00 am on Tuesday, February 22nd for my Veterans Mental Health Webinar. https://t.co/TVCGueKVsD

I want every member of our community to know that if they are in need of assistance with a federal agency, my office can help navigate the process and get the needed answers.

I was delighted to help Jeff & his daughter when they needed us. Hear his story ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/JiX7gBRopE

This #ValentinesDay, I was proud to help coordinate the delivery of over 1,300 valentines to veterans who receive care at the Atlanta VA Medical Center. Today and always, it is important that the men and women who served our country know that they are loved and cared for. https://t.co/JKt80UGjyA

As we continue to find ways to uplift young black men and keep our families safe, I hope we can go forward in strength and in hope. There is always hope. It is what brings us together. We must work toward a future we all believe in. #BHM #CSSBMBconnect

I'm proud to serve on the Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys (#CSSBMB) and to have worked to pass the law that establishes it.

My son, Jordan Davis, was murdered by a man with a gun, and now I'm fighting in Washington to protect children across the country. https://t.co/Eh5T1aMgRr

We must ensure that our children can pursue an education without fearing for their lives.

We have lost too many lives to gun violence. The time is upon us to make changes to protect our children and their futures.
I pray that we all work together to enact common-sense gun solutions that will prevent any more parents from celebrating their child‚Äôs birthday without them.
I sat watching this news unfold as I prepared to celebrate my son‚Äôs birthday- always a day of deep gratitude for the time we shared and profound sadness for the time that was taken from us.

Four years ago, I, like many Americans, sat horrified watching the news of the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School. 17 people were taken from us that day, and with them their hopes, dreams, and futures. https://t.co/Y6fA7pKa7Q

The @NAACP has had a profound impact in my own life. 

My father was president of the Illinois branch. He stood with President Johnson when the Civil Rights Act became law. He taught me to stand on the ‚Äúright side of right‚Äù and instilled in me a commitment to justice. https://t.co/xNJwXHQypA

This week in 1909, the @NAACP was founded with the vision to ‚Äúensure a society in which all individuals have equal rights, and there is no racial hatred or racial discrimination.‚Äù

113 years later, the fight continues and their vision remains potent.

Today we celebrate the International Day of Women and Girls in Science.

I'm so proud of‚Äîand grateful for‚Äîall the powerful, inspirational women & girls pushing our scientific innovation, research, and STEM education further.

This week in 1995, Bernard Anthony Harris Jr. became the first Black astronaut to perform a spacewalk.

Today, he continues to push for better STEM education across the country. His work during & after his time with NASA is hugely valuable, and we thank him. #BHM https://t.co/l1mUxZiJyf

I was proud to join my colleague @RepAndyLevin as a Vice Chair of @HouseGVP to introduce a bill that will help save lives, protect families, and keep guns out of the hands of those who should not have them.
With more than 4 million children living in homes with unsecured guns, it's more important than ever that we continue to advocate for common-sense policies to keep kids safe.

Veterans have sacrificed so much for our country, and we must continue doing all we can to serve them & their families.

I was proud to speak up on Raul‚Äôs behalf when he felt like he wasn‚Äôt getting answers from the Atlanta VA Medical Center. Hear his family's story‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/YPB6WTjjOU

.@TheBlackCaucus is the conscience of the Congress.

For us, #OurPowerOurMessage means turning our pain and our experiences into progress to serve our communities and bring about the change future generations need. #BHM https://t.co/iIZwalXodX

Trayvon Martin would be 27 today. For the past decade, this day has been one of grief for his parents when they should get to celebrate with their son.

My love is with them today and always. Happy birthday, Trayvon. We will never forget you. https://t.co/0TR1HYEsUD
With help from our office, Elizabeth J. from Cumming received her passport. https://t.co/8yKF83YqxM

#WorldCancerDay is close to my heart. As a two-time breast cancer survivor, I am so grateful for the lifesaving work of all those who support patients & survivors.

To those still fighting: I send you my love. #IAmAndIWill

Serving veterans like Kyle is one of the most important elements of my job‚Äîwe have a dedicated team of caseworkers to serve as the liaison between the federal agency and the constituent.

I was thrilled we were able to assist Kyle in his time of need. Learn more about his story‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/iQdjJ2u5hU

During Black History Month, I joined @AMC_Networks, @ColorOfChange, and @TheBlackCaucus to share what #OurPowerOurMessage means for our health, our families, and our communities. #BHM https://t.co/RveJapNBAA
Wishing everyone a Happy Lunar New Year! As we begin the #YearOfTheTiger, may it provide us with strength, courage, and bravery.

Today marks the start of National Gun Violence Survivors Week.

As a Vice Chair of @HouseGVP, I am standing with my fellow survivors to bring awareness to the violence that tears apart families across our nation. We must prevent these tragedies. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/HOgyGRb4fB

As a proud HBCU graduate, my thoughts are with all those dealing with these threats of violence.

No student should ever have to live or learn in fear.

As we celebrate the first day of Black History Month, there are again those with hate in their heart who seek to sow hatred and division.

Students across the country are at these HBCUs to work hard and create opportunities for themselves. https://t.co/AECocNSuvf

I am grateful to Justice Stephen Breyer for his decades of service to our nation's highest court.  His pragmatism, principle, and respect for the Constitution have served our nation, and I wish him well in his retirement.

Today, 77 years since the liberation of Auschwitz, we reaffirm our fight against antisemitism, bigotry, and violence.

We must do so in remembrance of the victims of the Holocaust, those who fought for liberation, and the families impacted since. #NeverAgain #HolocaustMemorialDay

Today, we observe the #InternationalDayofEducation.

In order to set our students up for success, we need to ensure that a high-quality education is accessible for all. I am proud to be a member of the @EdLaborCmte and continue our work to make this a reality.

I recently joined @GEEARS & the Open Arms Child Development Center for a roundtable discussion with parents, teachers, and providers about the importance of child care & the challenges they're facing. It was a joy to meet with some of our youngest neighbors‚Äîthanks for having me! https://t.co/gHdlnGiLdD
Alexa S. from Alpharetta received help from our team in obtaining her passport. https://t.co/aurxOHTas6
As we mark the 49th anniversary of the #RoevWade decision this week, the right to safe care is under threat across our country. We must continue to protect a woman‚Äôs right to choose.

Like many women in America, my story includes a struggle to get pregnant. My son Jordan was a miracle for us. For years, my doctor and I had been forced to make hard choices about my reproductive health, and every woman in our country deserves the same access to safe health care.

I was deeply saddened to hear of the loss of National President Cheryl A. Hickmon. My heart and deepest condolences are with her family, with her loved ones, and with all the ladies of Delta @dstinc1913. May we carry on her legacy of service, strength, and sisterhood. https://t.co/Bfu6Rh8pzI
The USPS anticipates the tests will ship within 7-12 days of ordering. If you experience shipping delays, please call their help desk at 1 (800) ASK-USPS or file an inquiry: https://t.co/14mdfLQ32q.

By testing, getting vaccinated, and continuing to wear our masks, we can all help stop the spread.

Every household can now order free at-home #COVID19 tests by visiting https://t.co/IJfu6IKX0h or calling 1 (800) 232-0233.

To participate, simply create a Valentine's Day card thanking local Georgia veterans for their service. Please drop off or mail your cards to my Sandy Springs District Office. The deadline for submissions is Friday, February 4th. Thank you for joining me in this effort!

I am proud to announce my third annual "Valentines for Veterans" program for veterans who receive care at the Atlanta VA Medical Center. My office will collect cards from #GA06 constituents and deliver them to the Atlanta VA Medical Center for distribution on Valentine's Day.

Today, we remember and celebrate the life of Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King Jr, his unwavering leadership, and his impact upon our lives. May we honor his work and his service with action by serving our own communities. https://t.co/o50BWPqVip

https://t.co/bBTrW3rv9L

Back in my home state, the Governor is trying to implement ‚Äúpermitless carry,‚Äù irresponsible legislation that is dangerous for our law enforcement, dangerous for our families, & dangerous for the people we love & cherish.

We can't allow these destructive efforts to continue.

At a time when the data is increasingly clear‚Äîthat more guns in the hands of those who should not have them results in more deaths of those who should still be alive today‚ÄîRepublican officials are trying to make it easier for anyone to wield guns around our children. https://t.co/MHCfylowp9

I am so proud to join @POTUS and @VP today in our state as we lead the fight to pass legislation to help guarantee the right of Americans across our country to cast their ballot without fear of interference or obstruction. https://t.co/VOHjuJFkB9

I was the child in the stroller at the March on Washington, and I was raised by my parents to always fight for what is right and what is just. To stand so that every American‚Äôs voice is heard and their vote is counted.
https://t.co/ABDwV1aILX

It's game day! I am cheering on our @UGAAthletics Bulldogs tonight as they take on the Crimson Tide in a rematch for the #NationalChampionship. Bulldog Nation, let's turn the tide and bring home a national title for the first time in 41 years! #GoDawgs
I have faith that the world's oldest democracy, the nation home to the American people‚Äîthe nation that will forever stand for freedom, justice, and liberty‚Äîwill remain triumphant. God bless.

As was true a year ago, I continue to pray for the safety of my colleagues and staff, of our law enforcement, and of our country. I pray for the values this nation was founded upon, and for the ideals that must endure long after we are gone.

As my Republican colleagues objected to President Biden‚Äôs clear victory, I prepared remarks in response to their attempt to overthrow the will of the people. I wanted to share those remarks again, today.
https://t.co/GjYKy1Dv8Y

One year ago, a group of violent and destructive individuals sought to overturn the results of an election‚Äîone decided by the will of the people.

Americans died as a result of that insurrection, including law enforcement officers.
My statement on the governor's proposed permitless carry legislation: https://t.co/yaTiwQjsGN

I'm wishing you all a safe, healthy, and joyous start to 2022!

This year was filled with incredible challenges. Do you have a memory from this year that you're holding close to your heart?
I want to wish a Happy #Kwanzaa to all celebrating this holiday season. May the seven principles of this holiday serve as a guiding light for you and your families.
Wishing you all a very healthy, safe, and Merry Christmas! We are sending blessings and love from my family to yours.

I was so proud to meet Sophia Thomas and hear all about how she is changing the world by teaching young people how to discover the joy of cooking!

Congratulations on making history, Sophia. https://t.co/A2jx7wO9Z9

Yesterday morning while preparing to do a Meals on Wheels delivery route with Senior Services of North Fulton, I ran into @ChairRobbPitts at his annual holiday meal distribution event!

I am so glad that we were able to provide meals and holiday cheer to those in our community. https://t.co/zKZGMatkR5
Our team helped Erin C. from Cumming receive her passport. https://t.co/xaouo1lsEt

"When our community has a stake in projects like these, we are lending a hand to those in need and recognizing that we are all our brothers' and sisters' keepers."

I was proud to join @HomeAidAtlanta at the ribbon cutting for the renovated Drake House in Roswell. From @CBS46‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/yaB2fOObWw

His vision for our nation transcended partisanship, and he was one of the truest representatives for all of Georgia, for our nation‚Äôs veterans, and for Americans everywhere. He will be dearly missed.
My whole heart is with @SenatorIsakson and his family today. He was one of the first to offer advice and friendship during my first year in office.

Ruofei and Ruohan Liu won third place for their app, Language Pro. 

Navya Nori won second place for her app, Medicast.
 
And in first place we had Austin and John Song with their app, RoboMaze!

Congratulations to our winners and to all participants!

This past weekend, I was thrilled to host my third annual @CongressionalAC award ceremony for participants in the 2021 Congressional App Challenge.

As I have been in past years, I was blown away by the level of talent and creativity demonstrated by our students.

At 2:30pm today, I am joining @amprog for a #StatesideChat on the threats to our free and fair elections. We must lead the fight to protect voting rights, and I hope you will join me for this critical conversation. Our democracy is on the line.

https://t.co/cKb3XWLEvy

Today marks nine years since 20 children and 6 educators had their lives stolen in a senseless act of gun violence at Sandy Hook Elementary. My heart is with the families whose lives were forever changed. 

We must protect our children's futures. We must #EndGunViolence.

Wishing the warmest of birthdays to my dear colleague @RepRaskin today. Jamie is an inspiration to me and everyone around him. We admire his intellect, compassion, and strength. Our hearts and our love are with him today. https://t.co/gPdRABBKjb

Thousands of families in our district & across our country are receiving crucial & valuable payments this week through the #ChildTaxCredit, historic tax cuts for the middle class. Of the 113,000 eligible children, 93,000 families have already received a combined $28.9 million.

I am heartbroken at the passing of Demaryius Thomas. He was a stand up athlete, a fierce competitor, and an even better person. His work with children put a smile on little faces everywhere, and my prayers are with all those whose lives he touched. https://t.co/j5uCjrdm1o

Today on #HumanRightsDay we commemorate the adoption of the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights. We must all continue to work together in the fight for global change and a better tomorrow.

Today marks 80 years since our country was forever changed by the loss of more than 2,300 servicemembers at Pearl Harbor.

We continue to honor the lives lost that day and commemorate the bravery and sacrifice of those who fought for our country in the years that followed.

Please join me in observing the anniversary of the ratification of the 13th Amendment, formally abolishing slavery in the U.S.
 
We must not forget that we stand on the shoulders of those who came before us. We must honor their legacies & continue our fight for American freedom.

At the beginning of a monumental movement, Rosa Parks bravely refused to give up her seat on a bus.

The Montgomery Bus Boycott was a turning point for our nation. We must continue to fight for change in the struggle against inequality.

I ask all of you to put yourselves in the shoes of the parents who have had to bury their babies.

Do you have the courage to do what is right to save our children? And if not, do you really‚Äîtruly‚Äîhave the courage to look away? https://t.co/IfIrmxmxia
I will speak on the House Floor momentarily about the tragic shooting in Michigan yesterday. Tune in here: https://t.co/NRrmmGFqG9.

We need to stand up to save American lives. We must have the courage‚Äîright now‚Äîto do what is right for the American people.

It is time for us to act. It is long past time.

I hear from families across America who do not have the confidence that we, Congress, will do what is needed to keep them safe.

They ask me, "what are we waiting for? What are we doing to protect our children?"
Parents begging their children "to barricade yourselves behind doors, to hide in classrooms, and to please, hold your tears, you cannot make a sound."
Our young people texting their parents from behind a desk saying things like, "Mom, if I don‚Äôt make it, I love you, and I appreciate everything you‚Äôve done for me."

Enough is enough. Enough gun violence in our schools. Enough children hiding in fear. Enough parents with pits in their stomach when they can‚Äôt reach their kids.

There were 100 calls made to 9-1-1 today. Hundreds of children stuck in their classrooms, crying out for help.
Patricia H. from Atlanta reached out to the office regarding an issue with the VA. https://t.co/l6qQgdCSVA
Wishing a very Happy Hanukkah to all celebrating! May your celebrations be filled with peace, love, and light.

Today we celebrate Small Business Saturday, a day dedicated to supporting the local small businesses that help our communities thrive. I encourage you to take the day to #ShopSmall and help uplift a small business near you.

Where will you be supporting today? ‚¨áÔ∏è

On Monday at 2:30pm, we'll be holding a Vietnam War Commemoration Pinning Ceremony. I invite you to join me in honoring and recognizing the service of our veterans and their families on behalf of a grateful nation.

Please use this link to join as a guest. https://t.co/cGEXjOFPxG
Kulbir S. from Atlanta contacted our office for assistance with USCIS. https://t.co/DNMWeYxFVr
Happy Thanksgiving, from my family to yours! I hope your day is filled with good food and gratitude, surrounded by loved ones.
Today, I am praying that we will end this epidemic of senseless gun violence in America, and one day, no parent will ever have to go through that pain.
Today, my prayers are with Ahmaud‚Äôs family, they are with every mother who has lost a child, and they are with every family who has lost a loved one so unnecessarily.

There is no verdict, no decision that can heal the wounds of losing a loved one. The sorrow we feel stays with us. It lives in all the love for our children we never had the chance to express. It lives in all the joy we never got to experience.
Today, #AhmaudArbery should be celebrating the holidays with his parents, his family, and his loved ones. My heart is with all of you during these challenging times.

Nine years later, you still inspire me every single day. I miss you, and I cherish those 17 years we had together. Though you no longer walk among us, your spirit is with those who hold you close, and your spirit lives in me.

I'm so proud of you. I will always be your Mom.‚ù§Ô∏è

I want you to know I am carrying out your legacy. You wanted to fight for change‚Äîand now, together, we are working toward that vision.

No other families should have to experience the pain of losing a loved one.

Today marks nine years since my son, Jordan, was shot for playing his music. It was Black Friday in 2012.

Jordan, I didn‚Äôt get to hug or kiss you goodbye. You were only 17 with your whole life ahead of you. My heart is still broken. https://t.co/3rP1lDz0Vo

In honor of "Public Health Thank You Day," I‚Äôd like to highlight the tremendous impact of those in Georgia and across the nation who work to protect us all and advance public health.

The past years have shown what we know to be true: your efforts save lives. #PHTYD
Please join me in sending very happy birthday wishes to @POTUS! Thank you for all your tireless work on behalf of the American people.

This historic investment will set us on a course to create millions of good-paying jobs, lower health care costs for our communities, provide tax cuts to hard-working families, and get Americans back to work and America back to normal.

Honored to stand at the White House this afternoon as @POTUS signs historic investments in infrastructure into law. This #AmericanEducationWeek, I encourage you all to thank a teacher who has made a positive impact on your life!

Accessibility to quality education is vital in shaping the minds of future generations. Thank you to all the educators who dedicate their lives to our children.

As a proud member of a military family, I know the sacrifice service members make to protect our freedom. This #VeteransDay, we not only say ‚Äúthank you,‚Äù but also reaffirm our commitment to ensure veterans and their loved ones have all the resources they need to thrive.

Today marks the 246th anniversary of the founding of the United States Marine Corps!
 
I‚Äôd like to personally extend my gratitude to all the service members who keep our country safe. #HappyBirthdayMarines @USMC https://t.co/aeslzGTQ86

I am saddened at the loss of former Senator Max Cleland. Whether in military service, political life, or working to serve fellow veterans, Max always kept the people of Georgia at the top of his mind. I send my condolences to all who knew and loved him. May he rest in peace.

This #VeteransSmallBusinessWeek, I want to recognize the veteran-owned businesses that help shape the #GA06 economy. We celebrate the veteran business owners who continue to empower communities across the country!
Sending warm wishes to our friends and neighbors celebrating #Diwali! May the festival of lights bring peace and joyous prosperity to you and your loved ones.

During the month of November we celebrate #MilitaryFamilyAppreciationMonth. We honor those who bravely answered the call to serve and recognize all their families who sacrificed alongside them. Thank you for your ongoing dedication to our country.

Today, I honored Jovita Moore. Her life was a positive force for good in this world. Little girls saw themselves in her on the television‚Äîknowing that one day, they could be the woman their community trusted at the end of each day. My heart is with her family & the @wsbtv team. https://t.co/GEut4jFyzx
Wishing a happy #DiaDeLosMuertos to the many friends and neighbors celebrating today and tomorrow! I hope you are able to honor the lives of your loved ones and celebrate in their memory.
Wishing all of our friends and neighbors a Happy Halloween! I hope everyone in #GA06 has a fun and safe time trick-or-treating this evening üéÉüëª

Today in @HouseJudiciary, we are acting to help those in crisis. We are acting to save lives. https://t.co/yxOfeqAbVt

I join our Jewish neighbors in continuing the fight against hate, against violence, and against antisemitism.

The anguish of far too many survivors of domestic violence during this pandemic has been a painful & unshakeable reminder of our fundamental need to put an end to it.

We just introduced the #BARKAct in the House, and I had to tell my puppy, Harley, about it. She thought our bi-paw-tisan bill was just paw-fect! https://t.co/vumCTqIkFy

Let's give our youngest learners the start they need to be successful in school and in life!

Join me in sending warm birthday wishes to @VP Kamala Harris!

Happy Birthday to you, and may you enjoy this special day with your friends and family, surrounded by love.

Are you a veteran of the Vietnam War? My office is holding our fourth Vietnam War Pinning Ceremony, and we would be honored to recognize your service at our event on November 29th at 2:30 pm. To sign up, please visit https://t.co/duHjjRW4OE.

Get involved. Remain a strong, powerful voice in your community. Talk to your legislators about the importance of preserving access to clean, safe & affordable water. Encourage your neighbors to join clean-up projects.

Every little bit helps & everyone can make a difference. https://t.co/BjM8oFQAOe

Investing in our communities and focusing on common-sense legislation that protects the health & safety of our environment will make a big difference toward providing our families with access to clean water. https://t.co/ufiC4ZlRlo

Clean water is imperative for the health of our children, the health of our families & the health of our communities. With resilient water infrastructure, we can make a real difference.

Clean, sustainable & innovative solutions will help protect water access for years to come. https://t.co/05884k1DSi

I am so proud to recognize these women who work hard every day to make a difference in the lives of others. As we celebrate the final week of Hispanic Heritage Month, may we all seek to champion Natalia and Zulma's values of strength, service, and patriotism every day.

In 2020, Zulma was elected to represent House District 86 in the Georgia House of Representatives, where she serves as the only Latina in the Georgia General Assembly. As an elected official in North DeKalb County, she represents some of the same constituents that I do in #GA06.

Born and raised in Puerto Rico, Zulma Lopez identifies herself as an immigration attorney, a small business owner, and most importantly, a mom. Her law practice gives families their own shot at the American dream by representing them as they move through the immigration process.

During the pandemic, We Love BuHi provided local and culturally centric food to nearly 15,000 families. Natalia was also an instrumental part of We Love BuHi‚Äôs multilingual vaccination outreach efforts with other local organizations and the cities of Dunwoody and Doraville.

Born in Colombia, Natalia is the director of development for @welovebuhi, an organization that works to preserve the multicultural identity of Atlanta‚Äôs Buford Highway. She is a founder of RISE, a nonprofit that seeks to empower students in low-income neighborhoods in Panama.

Each year from September 15 to October 15, we celebrate #HispanicHeritageMonth. This period encapsulates many celebrations of independence for Latin American countries. This year I am proud to highlight two women who deserve special recognition: Natalia Garz√≥n and Zulma Lopez.
